basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Yajahira Velazquez, you can call me Yari. I am an army veteran with a background in policing, transportation management, and medicine. Currently I own a web design company, Digital Transformation Consulting and Solutions, where I offer services from web design to digital marketing. I started my company for two reasons, one, I love working with computers. Computers have given me the opportunity to unlock my creative side and critical thinking. I have always been a problem solver, working in tech, is solving one problem after the next. This is an area where I excel. More importantly, feel that tech is the way of the future and I want to be part of that.  The second reason is because, tech allows the possibility of working remotely. After I finished my contract with the army, I went to medical school in Dominican Republic. Unfortunately, my circumstances changed and I was unable to continue, but I decided to stay living here. Working remotely will also give me more time with my kids. ðŸ˜Š ðŸ˜‰ ðŸ˜Ž

projects.title: Gallery of Horns
projects.description: The most expanded application I had the opportunity to create during a coding bootcamp. During this project, I had the opportunity to learn React. This application was designed to showcase the modal feature when the picture is clicked, the counter for the likes button, and the form to sort the beasts according to the number of horns.

projects.title: JASY Destinations
projects.description: This was a final group project for the first course in the coding bootcamp. Here we built an app that would take in info via a quiz and return a destination suggestion. In this app we were tasked with storing the responses to local storage and later retreiving them.

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: One of the first sites I built while in the coding bootcamp. I had to develop a front-end site for a ficticious cookie store. In this project I learned how to use Javascript to create a table that would update information randomly, and then later add a store to the table.
